results.title: Best foot forward
results.brief_description: This film notes how various crawling creatures move, and then goes on to emphasize the importance of footfall patterns in animals which must control the action of four limbs at once. Suitable for Upper Primary level students. No other credits availble.

results.title: Lilydale: a change in pace
results.creator_credit: Barbara Boyd-Anderson and Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch
results.brief_description: Presents two eras in the town of Lilydale in Victoria, the 1880’s and the 1980’s to form a case study of an Australian rural town as the metropolis advances towards it. It is a journey in time using archival photographs and diaries focusing particularly on the divergent life styles, attitudes and environments of the two eras of the district. Also includes a period recreation as a means to gain insights into those elements of Lilydale life. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Boyd-Anderson and Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch

results.title: England in the Middle Ages
results.creator_credit: David Boulton, Boulton-Hawker Films and Education Foundation for Visual Arts
results.brief_description: An overview of four hundred years of British history. Deals with the impact of the Norman Invasion; the Doomsday Book; the structure of medieval society; the importance of religion, castles, cathedrals and abbeys; the development of towns and trade; the Magna Carta; the Crusades; the beginnings of parliament; the Black Death; the decline of the fuedal system; the Peasant Revolt; the rise of the university and the Hundred Years War.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Boulton, Boulton-Hawker Films and Education Foundation for Visual Arts

results.title: Reaching out: Ken Tyler - master printer
results.creator_credit: Lee Tirce, Sid Avery, Avery and Tirce Productions
results.brief_description: Highlights the relationship between the printer and artist by focusing on Ken Tyler who has worked with many significant artists including Roy Lichtenstein, David Hockney, and Robert Rauschenberg. He has influenced these artists in refining and enlarging upon the boundaries of the printmaking art. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Grandfather's mitten
results.brief_description: A puppet animated film with bright music about a family of mice who make their home in a discarded mitten and their succession of new boarders. Provides a lesson in cooperative living.

results.title: Versatility in glass
results.brief_description:
Public relations film outlining the nature of glass: how it is made; how it can be used in its many and varied forms for decoration, safety and protection in the home, industry and transportation.
Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Economics for elementary: trade
results.creator_credit: Ray Nanley, Arthur G. Evans, Art Evans Productions and Oxford Films
results.brief_description:
Explains the role of the middle-man in trade using the retailing of tomatoes as an example. shows the growing of the crop and the labour employed; the selling of the crop to the wholesaler (distributor); the wholesaler’s overheads and how he distributes to retail outlets such as supermarkets and markets.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Paddington turns detective
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington receives a torch from Mr Gruber as a gift and receives an answer to his morse code signals from Mr. Brown’s greenhouse! He assumes the identity of Feathers Locke, Detective and proceeds to investigate, even fingerprinting Mr. Brown’s prize marrow! Adapted from Michael Bond’s book ‘More about Paddington’. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Music by Herbert Chappel.
